title: final price reduction - T210s, a  series 2 and a 5
author: FrankWakefield

posts.post_title: final price reduction - T210s, a  series 2 and a 5
posts.post_content:
I'm offering a few T210 Old Mill red border cards for sale...  payment by check, money order, or Paypal is fine. 1st class with delivery confirmation included, or will ship other ways at your cost. Emails to me at [url]fwakefield1@comcast.net[/url] are the way to ask questions or buy... preference to buy in order emails are received.

And thank you for looking.

Mike Balenti, a series 1 card showing him with Savanah. He played briefly for the Cincinnati Reds and the St. Louis Browns. $60 SOLD, thank you!!


George Manion, a series 1 card showing him with Jacksonville, the short stop played 6 years in the minors. $55 sold, thank you


Tom Messitt, a series 2 wide border card. Messitt appeared in 3 games in the majors, with Louisville, in 1894. He played a long time in the minors, 6 years at A level. This 1910 card would have been from his last year as a player.was $200, now $170
[IMG]http://i78.photobucket.com/albums/j106/greatwake/OMMessitRichs2.jpg[/IMG][IMG]http://i78.photobucket.com/albums/j106/greatwake/OMMessitRichs2back.jpg[/IMG]


Robert Bandy pitched for 5 years at Oklahoma City. A series 3 card. $45 SOLD, thank you!!!


Brooks Gordon played in the minors for 9 years, usually on teams in Texas. In 1910 the catcher was a manager and player for the Waco Navigators. Looks like he's holding the end of a catcher's mitt in his right hand, and a baseball box in his left. This card has the orange border that is occasionally found on some Old Mill series 3 cards. was $250, now $225 sale pending
[IMG]http://i78.photobucket.com/albums/j106/greatwake/OMGordonWacos3orange.jpg[/IMG] [IMG]http://i78.photobucket.com/albums/j106/greatwake/OMGordonWacos3orangeback.jpg[/IMG]

And the rest...  didn't realize there was a limit on the image quantity.

I'm offering a few T210 Old Mill red border cards for sale... payment by check, money order, or Paypal is fine. 1st class with delivery confirmation included, or will ship other ways at your cost. Emails to me at [url]fwakefield1@comcast.net[/url]  are the way to ask questions or buy... preference to buy in order emails are received.



Conolly, a series 4 card, this would be with the Charleston Senators (West Virginia) of the Virginia Valley League. A nice card. $95 SOLD, and Thank You.


Lothrop, Anderson, series 5. I think he was a pitcher. Only Lothrop I can find pitched for Charleston of the Mountain States League in 1911. The Anderson Electricians was a South Carolina team. was $80, now $65
[IMG]http://i78.photobucket.com/albums/j106/greatwake/OMLothropAnds5.jpg[/IMG]


Taylor, Goldsboro, series 7. A really nice card. I don't see a Taylor listed with the 1910 Goldsboro Giants. was $200, now $180 SOLD!!

George "Lucky" Whiteman played for the Red Sox and the Yankees. This series 8 card shows him with the Montgomery Climbers of the Southern Association. He was a player manager at the end of his career, 1905 through 1929. $240 SOLD, and going to a good home. Thanks.

Rich: E-mail sent re Balenti.
DMcD
Bumped for price reduction on remaining 4 cards.

Thanks again, Frank, money order on the way.
tbob
